newsitem.title: FRANCE: Chirac fortunes improve slightly in French poll.
newsitem.headline: Chirac fortunes improve slightly in French poll.

text.p: An opinion poll published on Wednesday saw a slight improvement in the low popularity of French President Jacqes Chirac and Prime Minister Alain Juppe, both buffeted by near-record unemployment and planned layoffs.
A Gallup survey for the weekly L'Express said 46 percent of voters disapproved of Chirac in August against 47 percent in July while 43 percent approved of him, versus 40 percent.
The premier's disapproval rating stood unchanged at 57 percent but 37 percent of those asked supported him, up three percentage points from July.

The poll was taken in late August, following a police raid to evict African immigrants who had occupied a Paris church to fight expulsion orders. The government had sought to portray the raid as a tough stance on illegal immigration.
A Louis Harris poll for the business magazine Valeurs Actuelles highlighted a jump in general gloominess about the stagnating economy and prospects for labour conflicts.
It said 62 percent of those asked thought the economy was getting worse, against 44 percent in June.
Only six percent thought things were getting better, down sharply from 13 percent in the earlier survey.
Chirac was credited with a 38 percent approval rating against 44 percent in July, while Juppe got the thumbs down from 55 percent against 60 percent in the earlier poll.
